title: Introduction
historical_context: This issue of Phrack was released during a time when hacking culture was evolving with the rise of the internet and increased media attention on hacker activities.
target_audience: Hackers, security researchers, and enthusiasts of hacker culture.
short_summary: The introduction to Phrack Volume 61 outlines the contents of the issue, including various articles on hacking techniques and tools, as well as updates on the zine's format and distribution.
summary: In the introduction to Phrack Volume 61, the editors express their excitement about the release, noting the inclusion of 16 articles along with smaller pieces in the 'linenoise' section. They mention a shift away from outdated file naming conventions and the removal of a buggy extraction utility that had been included in previous issues. The editors also acknowledge a slight delay in the release, humorously addressing the existence of unofficial beta versions circulating among the community. The introduction sets the tone for the issue, highlighting the blend of technical content and the irreverent spirit characteristic of Phrack.
additional_notes: The editors encourage readers to engage with the content and provide feedback, emphasizing the zine's commitment to accuracy while also acknowledging the potential for errors. This reflects the community-driven nature of Phrack, where contributions from various authors enrich the collective knowledge.
